chapter.title: Customizing Layout of the Output Formats

sect1.title: Modifying Individual XSLT Processor Parameters
sect1.para: If you use the default DocBook layout and want to adjust individual parameters, you can use the --xsltparam. With the option, you can pass on values for an XSLT parameter directly to the XSLT processor. This is useful to temporarily overwrite style sheet parameters such as margins.
For larger or more complex modifications, such as adjustments of the title page layout, for example, it is advisable to develop your own set of stylesheets instead.
For a list of XSLT parameters to modify, refer to one of the following parameter references at :

example.title: &wip;
example.para: By default, the DocBook stylesheets display the contents of a variablelist as a table. To change this temporarily, set the parameter variablelist.as.table to the value 0. Execute the following command:

sect1.para: &wip;: Add one or more xslt processor parameters in the form of "'--stringparam KEY=VALUE' --param KEY=VALUE". The given string will be passed unmodified to the xsltprocessor call that creates the .fo file from the profiled sources. Note: You MUST quote the string with double and single quotes: --xsltproc="'STRING'"
